Name: Pedro Avelino
description:
Pedro Avelino is an indigenous agriculturist and fish farmer from Silvia, Cauca, with more than 23 years of knowledge practicing in both activities.

He currently owns a two-hectare plot of land that was assigned by his indigenous council, where he distributes potato crops, 1,000 strawberry plants and four domestic ponds with 2,800 alvine trout dispersed by age.

Pedro sells his trout to wholesale suppliers in his municipality who later distribute it to different cities around the country.

Pedro lives with his wife and three children, ages 17, 13 and 4, in a house he bought 20 years ago. His wife works alongside him supporting him in raising and feeding the trout.

A loan of $5,138,407 COP helps Pedro to purchase of organic flours that will potentiate the growth of his trout.
